intro: Ruellia amapensis, commonly known as the Brazilian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Ruellia amapensis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
